task_summary: Pick up the red object from the table using a robot arm by detecting, aligning to, grasping, and lifting the object as evidenced in the 9 frames.

task_long_description.overview: This sequence describes a robotic manipulator assigned to pick up a red object from a table in an uncluttered, static scene. The arm executes visual search and confirmation, approaches from above, opens the gripper, aligns with the red object, and performs a controlled grasp followed by a lifting motion. The red object and table are the primary elements. The process is cautious: vision checks, repeat attempts if needed, and confirmation of grasp before lifting.
preconditions: Red object present and visible on table
stepwise_plan: Check if red object is visible; if not, scan up to 3 times.
Detect precise position of red object.
Move above the red object to an offset height.
Approach and align to the object with precision.
Confirm object is secured in gripper.
Lift the red object 0.10m above the table.
success_criteria: Red object is held securely in gripper
Red object is lifted off the table
No collision with other objects or workspace
failure_and_recovery: If object is not visible, repeat scan for up to 3 attempts.
If grasp fails, task terminates (further recovery not included in sequence).
If contact is not detected, approaching action may be retried or adjusted.
task_long_description.termination: Task ends upon successful grasp confirmation and lift of the red object above table height.

frame_3.now_evidence: end effector initial contact and alignment above red object
frame_3.predicts_next: finer alignment or approach; signals transition from approach to contact phase

task_instruction: pick up the red object from the table

node_specs.description: Checks if the red object is currently visible.
Scans the workspace to locate the red object using a grid pattern.
Detects and localizes the precise position of the red object.
Moves the end effector to a position directly above the red object with a specified vertical offset.
Opens the gripper to allow space for grasping the red object.
Aligns gripper with the red object prior to grasp, with precise tolerance.
Lowers gripper at slow speed until contact is detected with moderate force.
Closes the gripper to grasp the red object with specified force.
Checks if the red object has been successfully grasped.
Lifts the grasped red object 0.10 meters above current position.

failure_modes: Red object not detected in workspace.
Gripper fails to close or grasp unstable.
recovery_strategy: Retry visual scan up to 3 times.
Abort on persistent grasp or perception failure.
assumptions: Red object matches instruction and is confirmed in all 9 frames.
No other objects interfere with the grasp according to visual evidence.
No 'place' phase observed in frames; only pick and lift.
Instruction and frames are consistent for a 'pick only' BT (place is not attempted/shown).

expected_success_criteria: Successful and stable grasp of red object.
Red object held above table after pick.
